text: Semeliškės () is a town in Elektrėnai municipality, Vilnius County, east Lithuania. According to the Lithuanian census of 2011, the town has a population of 580 people. The town has a church of Catholics and Orthodox church of St. Nicolas. Its alternate names include Sameliškės, Semelishkes, Semelishkis, Semeliškių, Sumelishki, Sumilishki, Siemieliszki, and Sumiliszk.United States Board of Geographic Names - Semeliškės. Accessed January 23, 2014. ==History== Memorial at the execution site of the Jews of the town. On October 6, 1941, 962 Jews of the town were murdered in a mass execution perpetrated by an Einsatzgruppen of local policemen and Lithuanian collaborators.http://www.holocaustatlas.lt/EN/#a_atlas/search//page/1/item/127/ ==References== ==External links== * The murder of the Jews of Semeliškės during World War II, at Yad Vashem website. title: Semeliškės
